title: Ticket #6834: FindRunnableJob() causes aggressive rebuilding of PrioRec array
description:
FindRunnableJob() will rebuild the PrioRec array if it's marked as dirty. When iterating over the PrioRec array, it will mark the array as dirty if it sees a job in the array that's already been matched to a resource. This will force a rebuild of the PrioRec array the next time FindRunnableJob() is called.

If there are frequent calls to FindRunnableJob() in a short period of time, many of those calls will see the job returned in the previous call as already matched and mark the array as dirty, forcing a rebuild in the next call. The rebuilds in this case are meant for efficiency, not correctness. But they end up rebuilding the entire array to remove one entry.

A couple changes can reduce this unnecessary work:

  • FindRunnableJob() shouldn't trigger a rebuild of the PrioRec array every time it sees non-runnable jobs in the array. It could either not trigger a rebuild at all or there could be a rate limit on rebuilds for efficiency.
  • When building the PrioRec array, skip jobs that are Idle but are in a match record.
